slime.name: Slime
slime.description: Adored by all for its flexy physique and funny face, this little monster is something of an icon. Who wouldn't want one for a pal?

goonache_goodie.name: Goonache Goodie
goonache_goodie.description: Enticed or perhaps entranced by the alluring aroma, this is what becomes of chocoslimes who pop their heads inside tempting pockets of pastry only to find themselves firmly stuck.

buddy_slime.name: Buddy Slime
buddy_slime.description: A variety of slimes who were so fond of their greens, they winded up sprouting leaves. Now they soak up sunshine and satisfy their stomachs through photosynthesis.

wing_slime.name: Wing Slime
wing_slime.description: Slimes which sprouted wings after dreaming of soaring through the sky. Their wings double up as a snug sleeping bag at night.

bubble_slime.name: Bubble Slime
bubble_slime.description: These unfortunate creatures were once normal slimes until permeated by swamp poison, causing their bodies to collapse like underbaked meringue.

healslime.name: Healslime
healslime.description: These soft-centred slimes simply cannot stand by when they spy someone in need. Word has it there's one in particular who travels far and wide in pursuit of his dream of becoming human.

slimeshroom.name: Slimeshroom
slimeshroom.description: Strange slimes that have spent so much time in damp and dreary places that spores have settled on them and sprouted from their curvy contours.

fright_bulb.name: Fright Bulb
fright_bulb.description: These vegetable monsters simply sprouted from the earth one day. Their shrieks are said to root anyone who hears them to the spot.

feral_slime.name: Feral Slime
feral_slime.description: Slimes which live in the unforgiving rainforest. These hardened survivors will do whatever it takes to escape predators, be it holding their breath under muddy waters or climbing high above the canopy of trees.

snowmangler.name: Snowmangler
snowmangler.description: A snowy slime that could easily pass as a regular snowman. After they melt, they're carried into the next life by a host of angel slimes.

slime_stack.name: Slime Stack
slime_stack.description: Three fast friends who decided to see how things stacked up when they stuck closer together. Apparently, they're training to one day become a king slime.

slime_knight.name: Slime Knight
slime_knight.description: These pint-sized slime chevaliers cannot abide dishonourable deeds. They patrol the land atop their slippery steeds in order to ensure no harm befalls slimekind.

she_slime.name: She-Slime
she_slime.description: These slimes are proud of their quirky colouration, which is likely the product of a genetic fluke. They feel faintly warm to the touch.

onion_slime.name: Onion Slime
onion_slime.description: Slimes which overindulged on onions until they took on their appearance. They hail from an area famed for its outstanding alliums and spread throughout the land as the local onion business boomed.

drake_slime.name: Drake Slime
drake_slime.description: These orange slimes love dragons so much they've sculpted their own bodies into imitations to their idols. They long to grow up to be fully-fledged dragons.

mottle_slime.name: Mottle Slime
mottle_slime.description: Every one of these distinctive slimes sports a unique coat of spots. Sadly, these timid creatures spend most of their time terrified of something or other.

spiny_slime.name: Spiny Slime
spiny_slime.description: Slimes which somehow managed to grow spines after gobbling down some iffy food. They attack by using their spikes to rotate at rapid speed, like the spinning tops they resemble.

dark_slime.name: Dark Slime
dark_slime.description: Devilish slimes who have drunk deep from the well of darkness. Before marching off to do mischief, they issue their distinctive battle cry: '(slurp) Get ready for a terrible slime!'

behemoth_slime.name: Behemoth Slime
behemoth_slime.description: These slimes grew to ginormous size after inhaling a mysterious substance known as dark matter. And no, they are absolutely not king slimes who have mislaid their crowns!

king_slime.name: King Slime
king_slime.description: This solemn sovereign reigns over slimekind. Its regal rotundity is only matched by its great surplus of spirit.

wild_slime.name: Wild Slime
wild_slime.description: These slimy scamps' trademark is their magnificent mohican. Surprisingly, given their reputation as the enfants terribles of the slime family, they really look up to grandpa slimes, and dream of sporting beards of their own one day.

dragon_slime.name: Dragon Slime
dragon_slime.description: These slimes are descended from dragons and are justly proud of their breath attacks. In fact, they'd rather grill their own steaks, even when dining in the fanciest of eateries.

dark_king_slime.name: Dark King Slime
dark_king_slime.description: Despite having wings, these sovereign slimes are sadly ground-bound. They secretly seethe at the sky-soaring show-off antics of the dark slimes who serve them.

cococoa_blobelisk.name: Cococoa Blobelisk
cococoa_blobelisk.description: A trio of chocolate-coated siblings. The youngest annd palest of the crew balances on top of the sweet-tasting stack, with the ever-so-slightly bitter eldest shouldering the burden of both of his brothers at the bottom.

king_bubble_slime.name: King Bubble Slime
king_bubble_slime.description: Rulers of bubble slime-kind, whose deadly drool forms malignant mires as it collects. It might not look like it, but they are actually pondering all manner of profound matters.

beshemoth_slime.name: Beshemoth Slime
beshemoth_slime.description: She-slimes who have absorbed an abundance of dark matter develop these bulky bodies, though they retain their squidy essence.

shadow_slime.name: Shadow Slime
shadow_slime.description: These squishy sorts turnend jet black after mastering the speediest of slime skills. They can fling themselves forward so fast they virtually catch fire as they fly!

metal_slime_knight.name: Metal Slime Knight
metal_slime_knight.description: These strong, silent types are superlative skirmishers. Incidentally, a metal slime knight's EXP is the sum of the metal slime and its rider's EXP, divided by two.

shogum.name: Shogum
shogum.description: This slime army commander is said to have pioneered the paired sword school of combat. It searches ceaselessly for its nine missing companions, who once assembled will unleash utter devastation on the world.

dragonthorn.name: Dragonthorn
dragonthorn.description: Cursed thickets of thorn tangled into draconic shape. Those entwined in their terrifying clutches have no hope of escape.

komodo.name: Komodo
komodo.description: Nippy little dragons who have learned to stand on their highly developed hind legs. At full pelt they can outpace a racehorse, but haven't yet mastered the subtle art of slowing down.

airbagon.name: Airbagon
airbagon.description: Dragons who love giving humans a good fright by inflating themselves and then making themselves burst. In order to get the biggest bang they can, they inhale huge volumes of air but occasionally wimp out before they pop.

vegandragora.name: Vegandragora
vegandragora.description: Dragons which live in harmony with herbs and flowers. They love nothing more than basking in the sun and will get together to lap up the sun's rays on summer days.

damselfly.name: Damselfly
damselfly.description: These dragons like to ensorcell travellers with their beautiful fairy wings. Not only bewitching to behold, their wings release a fine powder which puts their prey in a trance.

pteranodon.name: Pteranodon
pteranodon.description: Highly adaptable as the world has changed around them, these flying reptiles have endured since the primeval past. Indeed, references to them have been found in the very earliest writings.

armoured_wartoise.name: Armoured Wartoise
armoured_wartoise.description: These terrible tortoises' steely spike-studded shells are so solid they'll shatter any sword struck against them. However, the price they pay for their formidable defences is that they move slower than molasses.

briny_bronco.name: Briny Bronco
briny_bronco.description: Seahorse monsters that love to spend their days suspended in the surf. Who knows what purpose their little booties serve, because they certainly aren't for walking.

drag_racer.name: Drag Racer
drag_racer.description: Dragons that use their powerful hind legs to propel themselves forward and dish out high-speed headbutts. One of the speediest monsters around--at full pelt, you won't see them for dust.

jargon.name: Jargon
jargon.description: These chaps will shove anything and everything into their beloved jars--pickles, preserves, jams, chutneys... Oh, and the occasional weapon too.

wyrtle.name: Wyrtle
wyrtle.description: These dragons were in fact once turtles who lived for a thousand years before feasting on the flesh of a sacred dragon and taking on their current form. Watch out for their spinning body slam!

gasbagon.name: Gasbagon
gasbagon.description: Dragons which float using gas trapped in their bellies, and are best kept away from open flames. However, they themselves are capable of breathing fire, which is not only dangerous, but tends to leave them looking rather deflated.

mandrake_major.name: Mandrake Major
mandrake_major.description: Draconic duelists who mainly subsist as soldiers of fortune. Their stellar swordplay is considered some of the finest in all Nadiria.

axesaurus.name: Axesaurus
axesaurus.description: The striking red-hued subspecies of hacksaurus is capable of raining down brutal blows with their battle-axes andn exhaling equally fearsome fire-breath

tundragster.name: Tundragster
tundragster.description: Dragons with scales as white as snow. Superstitious folk living in cold regions believe them to cause natural disasters and as such steer well clear.

liege_lizard.name: Liege Lizard
liege_lizard.description: These magnificent monarchs of lizardking are as daunting as any dragon. Their fulsome flames only serve to justify their high opinion of themselves.

noble_gasbagon.name: Noble Gasbagon
noble_gasbagon.description: Dragons blown up to blimpish proportion. Full of floaty gas, who knows how far one would fly if you pulled out that tantalisinng cork at the tip of its tail...

dread_dragooner.name: Dread Dragooner
dread_dragooner.description: These black-mailed dragon knights serve the Master of Monsterkind. Owing to the largesse of their liege lord, they can wield the power of darkness itself in battle.

iron_tortoise.name: Iron Tortoise
iron_tortoise.description: These rough-hewn reptiles live for tens of thousands of years and are believed to be messengers sent from the gods. They are fiercely protective of their shells--try touching it and you're in for a shock!

stark_raven.name: Stark Raven
stark_raven.description: These creepy corvids can't resist scooping up skulls from ancient battlefields. Fledgling ravens like to clamber through the eye-holes to hide from predators.

bantamweight.name: Bantamweight
bantamweight.description: These thumping great chickens have learned how to fly. Thanks to their highly-developed flight muscles, they can strike with the power of a trainer pugilist.

killerpillar.name: Killerpillar
killerpillar.description: Though these creepy-crawlies might look like larvae, they are in fact fully grown. They keep themselves warm in cold weather by rolling up into snug little balls.

capsichum.name: Capsichum
capsichum.description: These terrible twins are in fact born already skewered. Always butting heads, they are often witnessed mid-argument.

mad_mollusk.name: Mad Mollusk
mad_mollusk.description: These monsters have two mouths, one at each end. The one at the front is a strict vegetarian, while the one on the tail is meat mad.

woebergine.name: Woebergine
woebergine.description: These adorable vegetable-based monsters are proud of their ability to cut some rug. Any traveller straying into their terrain should be prepared to see them strut their stuff.

khalamari_kid.name: Khalamari Kid
khalamari_kid.description: These squid-like squirts are baby khalamri. Though small in stature, they're as tough as any full-grown sea-dweller.

toady.name: Toady
toady.description: These ample amphibians might have mutated into mega-sized monsters, but they retain their original love for croaking out a tune. They like to put on evening concerts just after the rain lets up.

bullfinch.name: Bullfinch
bullfinch.description: Once birds, these creatures evolved into the bipedal bull-like form you see today. Don't call them chicken, or you'll find yourself on the horns of a dilemma.

cyclown.name: Cyclown
cyclown.description: These wicked wind spirits sport their whirlwinds like work attire. Their greatest desire is to welcome wanderers into their whirling worlds.

odd_cob.name: Odd Cob
odd_cob.description: Diabolic cobs of corn. Rumour has it that popping their kernels over a medium heat will turn them into a slightly odd-tasting but perfectly palatable popcorn.

scissor_beatle.name: Scissor Beatle
scissor_beatle.description: Nothing escapes the clutches of their two tremendous mandibles. Often found clashing with rival creepy-crawlies over the sap of unfortunate treefaces.

bagworm.name: Bagworm
bagworm.description: These monsters protect their bodies by wrapping themselves into sticks. Think yourself lucky you don't have to see the horrifying form hidden underneath!

scornet.name: Scornet
scornet.description: Wild hornets which have been transformed by monsters into veritable arthropod assassins. Be wary of their stingers, which can spurt a paralysing poison.

crabid.name: Crabid
crabid.description: These monsters hunt their prey in squadrons. Highly disciplined troops, as soon as the orders come in from the top brass, they file back to their barracks in an orderly fashion.

barracuda.name: Barracuda
barracuda.description: Fiendishly big fishes with heads so hard it's said they can punch through the hull of a ship with enough of a swim-up.

tree_feller.name: Tree Feller
tree_feller.description: These monsters are in fact sprites which inhabit infernal foliage. They roam the globe seeding saplings, but often succumb to homesickness, and are occasionally seen shedding tears in the shade of a shrub.

spinchilla.name: Spinchilla
spinchilla.description: These wave-bound warriors wheel about in whirlpools, freezing foes they find into floes of floating ice.

zaptile.name: Zaptile
zaptile.description: These amped-up amphibians store ample supplies of electricity inside their bodies. The unmistakeable scent of fried fish follows these frogs around whenever they venture into the water...

palooka_prawn.name: Palooka Prawn
palooka_prawn.description: These shelled sluggers, sick of life at sea, only want to prove to all the doubters that they can go the distance living on land.

carnivine.name: Carnivine
carnivine.description: These carnivorous plants aren't rooted to the spot. When young and small they eat insects, but can eventually grow so large they can gobble up a boss troll in a couple of bites.

grillerpillar.name: Grillerpillar
grillerpillar.description: Crimson caterpillar monsters born in volcanoes. When they overuse their fiery breath attacks, their throats are sure to be sore the next day.

tufty_tot.name: Tufty Tot
tufty_tot.description: These fluffy dandelion seeds seem to soothe the soul. Little is knonwn about their origins, but some think they're the downy fuzzy from flowers which sprout upon the World Tree, Yggdrasil.

armoured_scorpion.name: Armoured Scorpion
armoured_scorpion.description: Scorpions which might as well be walking shields, such is the protection givenn by their exoskeletons. If an adventurer should find one blocking their path, their best hope is to find a tiny chink in their armour.

crabber_dabber_doo.name: Crabber Dabber Doo
crabber_dabber_doo.description: These blood-curdling crustaceans are possessed of claws so sharp they're capable of cutting absolutely anything in half, even icorporeal ghosts and ghouls.

clobster.name: Clobster
clobster.description: Ancient crustaceans which slumbered underground until revived by rainfall. All signs point to their original habitat being the ocean.

antguzzler.name: Antguzzler
antguzzler.description: These long-snouted monsters resemble spiny anteaters. Their length tongues are well-adapted to slurping army ants up from their nests.

mischievous_mole.name: Mischievous Mole
mischievous_mole.description: These tunnelling tykes traditionally loved to play pranks, but these days tend to keep their heads down and focus on digging.

bunicorn.name: Bunicorn
bunicorn.description: These creatures might resemble rabbits, but meet one of their horns head-on and you'll understand the difference rather sharpish. They pass the long nights huddled together in their warrens.

fat_rat.name: Fat Rat
fat_rat.description: These hefty rodents might outweigh their animal couterparts by a considerable margin, but they are similarly drawn to dark and dank locations such as caves and sewers.

candy_cat.name: Candy Cat
candy_cat.description: These carefree kitties are beloved by some for their trademark lolling tongues and fetching stripy coats. Their fur is delightfully fluffy, but it's probably best ot to attempt to pet them.

sham_hatwitch.name: Sham Hatwitch
sham_hatwitch.description: Boarish beasts who set out on journeys of personal discovery in order to overcome their cowardice. Though they still hide behind the broad brims of their beloved headwear, they have become far less timid.

feralball.name: Feralball
feralball.description: This flufball is covered in green fur from top to toe. Though easily spooked, those with sharp eyes might spot something funny where this beastie's nose should be before it scarpers.

great_sabrecub.name: Great Sabrecub
great_sabrecub.description: The offspring of a great sabrecat. If taken in at an early age and lavished with care and affection, these monsters can be tamed and kept as pets.

mouseflap.name: Mouseflap
mouseflap.description: Rascally rodents with enormous ears which can open up like a parachute to help them glide through the air. At night they wrap themselves in their lengthy lugs to keep warm.

orc.name: Orc
orc.description: These boar-like brutes are far from boorish--though most make careers out of combat, many tire of battle and bloodshed and dream of laying down their spears in favour of pen or brush, becoming poets and artists instead.

vampire_cat.name: Vampire Cat
vampire_cat.description: These feline fiends are often found flying through the skies. If you catch one grooming itself, it's a sure sign it's about to rain.

guaardvark.name: Guaardvark
guaardvark.description: These mad marsupials love to collect human craniums and carry their favourite specimen around at all times.

robber_rabbit.name: Robber Rabbit
robber_rabbit.description: Roving rabbits which pilfer farmers' produce to survive. Their identity-concealing masks are family harelooms passed down from one generation to the next.

boppin_badger.name: Boppin' Badger
boppin_badger.description: Who can resist that ballooning belly and the lustrous leaf it wields? Capable of taking on a multitude of different forms, this trickster love playing pranks on unsuspecting adventurers.

ursa_major.name: Ursa Major
ursa_major.description: Wild bears which are vicious to the core. Their territorial disputes can get seriously grisly and can clear whole forests of monsters.

dark_sabrecub.name: Dark Sabrecub
dark_sabrecub.description: Though small in stature, these ferocious felines are positively brimming with malice and are ready to take a swipe at any foe, no matter what their size.

splatypunk.name: Splatypunk
splatypunk.description: Try-hard platypunkns who work to differentiate themselves from their paler cousins. They may not look precisely like platypunks, but they certainly quack like them.

ripped_rabbit.name: Ripped Rabbit
ripped_rabbit.description: There's nothing funny about these bunnies. They hopped out of the warren young and got their education in the school of hard knocks, meaning solitude holds on fear for them.

maniacal_mole.name: Maniacal Mole
maniacal_mole.description: Elder cousins of the mischievous moles. They will not stannd for sloppy safety standards on a dig-site and anyone who trespasses on their turf can expect a pounding from one of their pickaxes.

notso_macho.name: Notso Macho
notso_macho.description: Muscly monsters who wield bulky, broad-bladed swords. Don't be fooled by their flabby physique--these fearsome fighters will fly at you fast!

luneyetic.name: Luneyetic
luneyetic.description: Though legend has it that they were born on the moon, no-one's certain where these creatures really come from. Perhaps their skill wielding ancient magic is a clue?

macho_picchu.name: Macho Picchu
macho_picchu.description: This fiend, who lurks deep in the labyrinth of another world, has a highly honed sense of style. Rumoured to have stolen the Cirrus Surplice, once the treasure of an ancient tribe.

eggsoskeleton.name: Eggsoskeleton
eggsoskeleton.description: Mysterious creatures who ride in curious ovoid contraptions capable of great vaulting leaps. What these pilots actually look like is anyone's guess.

cumaulus.name: Cumaulus
cumaulus.description: These creatures are clumps of living cloud. Often at the mercy of the weather, you might clap eyes on a stray cumaulus on an especially windy day.

string_fella.name: String Fella
string_fella.description: Ropey rapscallions prone to loneliness when not tangled up in someone else's business. They need to replace their string regularly, or risk fraying at the seams.

bambooligan.name: Bambooligan
bambooligan.description: Clockwork contraptions modelled on killing machines but built from bamboo to keep the cost of manufacture down.

fromage_fray.name: Fromage Fray
fromage_fray.description: Infamous fondue filching fiends who are hell-bent on devouring as much dairy as they can. Inveterate dine and dashers, no matter how much provolone they pack away, they never seem to get a stitch when cheesing it from the scene of the crime.

mecha_mynah.name: Mecha-Mynah
mecha_mynah.description: Adorable clockwork avians made by monsters to monitor mankind. Their inner mechanisms are so heavy, they break the branches of any tree on which they attempt to perch.

lampling.name: Lampling
lampling.description: These sparky spirits inhabit lanterns that have been discarded by their owners. They like to terrify unfortunate adventurers who tramp their terrain at night.

bag_o_laughs.name: Bag o' Laughs
bag_o_laughs.description: Easily amused monsters with beaming smiles. Their comedy routines are essentially self-sustaining--they think their own gags are pure genius, and the instant they recall one, they crack up all over again.

foo_dog.name: Foo Dog
foo_dog.description: Hellish hounds employed in the underworld as ghastly guard dogs. Bloodthirsty to the bone, even fellow monsters give these mutts a wide berth.

disfigurine.name: Disfigurine
disfigurine.description: Cuddly toy creatures which conceal spikes in their cushioning, ready to skewer anyone fooled by their cutesy facade.

bongo_drongo.name: Bongo Drongo
bongo_drongo.description: Sturdy spirits in the thrall of their large-faced bongos. All manner of monsters are drawn in by their deft drumming, entranced by the intricate rhapsody of rhythm.

avian_android.name: Avian Android
avian_android.description: Winged killers originally constructed to be used as tools of interrogation. They probe for the truth using highly-focused sound waves, coupled with the hypnotic effect of their multi-coloured feathers.

erazor_blade.name: Erazor Blade
erazor_blade.description: These monsters come to life when sinful souls settle in sabres which travellers have left for scrap. The blades are impeccably maintained, their sharpness visible in every sinister sparkle.

cannibox.name: Cannibox
cannibox.description: Tricksters who pretend to be treasure chests in order to spring sneak attacks on unsuspecting travellers. They absolutely will not stand for running away--attempt this too many times and you're really asking for it.

pocus_poppet.name: Pocus Poppet
pocus_poppet.description: Clay figures that have been invested with minds of their own. They are used by sorcerers and necromancers for various purposes, and it is believed that long ago, they were used to summon up powerful spirits of the dead.

hunter_mech.name: Hunter Mech
hunter_mech.description: Merciless mechs made to hunt metallic slimes. Sick of their swift and cowardly quarry, they hope they'll be upgraded into killing machines one day.

clockwork_cuckoo.name: Clockwork Cuckoo
clockwork_cuckoo.description: Adorable clockwork avians made by monsters to massacre mankind. Their ferrous feathers are fabulously sharp--even a single flap could prove fatal.

escudogre.name: Escudogre
escudogre.description: The mean-looking monsters might wield loathsome living shields, but it turns out they are actually big shy softies behind closed doors.

harmour.name: Harmour
harmour.description: Weather-worn armour of a dead man come to life by means of a ghastly grudge. Abandoned half-exposed in the rain, the sinister half is rusted bright red.

rockbomb.name: Rockbomb
rockbomb.description: This rocky monster is famed for its snickering smirk. Make it mad and it'll cast 'kamikazee' and go out with a bang. An inspiration for rockers the world over.

hell_nino.name: Hell Nio
hell_nino.description: These monsters are nothing less than sentient puffs of superheatead volcano smoke. They are known to split once they reach a certain size, both new beings sharing the same mind.

killing_machine.name: Killing Machine
killing_machine.description: Single-minded slayers who keep shooting and slicing until their target is slain. Powered by perpetual engines, their innards don't require maintenance, but their red eye lamps need to be replaced frequently.

abracadabrador.name: Abracadabrador
abracadabrador.description: These hellish hounds can whip up hurricanes when they howl. However, despite their ferocious nature, they become obedient lapdogs in the presence of their master.

stone_golem.name: Stone Golem
stone_golem.description: Bogeymen built from boulders that have absorbed masses of malevolence and misery. They often lurk amongst the wreckage and rubble of ruined towns and buildings.

bag_o_tricks.name: Bag o' Tricks
bag_o_tricks.description: A welcome sight to any seeker of fortune, these auspicious sacks are full of handy implements for any adventure. They're prone to stumbling when overexcited, spilling their precious wares all over the place.

dancing_flame.name: Dancing Flame
dancing_flame.description: Monsters born of human souls set ablaze through sheer fury. They have moves as fierce, fiery and frenzied as you might expect.

flamethrower.name: Flamethrower
flamethrower.description: Blazing battle-proven brethren who can fling flame and spit fire. Though they might look like they're hot-tempered hoodlums, they're actually quite calm and collected underneath.

bamboogieman.name: Bamboogieman
bamboogieman.description: Battlefield commanders who spearhead squadrons of bamboo spear-wielding soldiers. No cowards, they'll enter the fray themselves when the battle heats up.

hard_boiled_eggsoskeleton.name: Hard-Boiled Eggsoskeleton
hard_boiled_eggsoskeleton.description: These mottled mechanical eggs eggsude a palpable sense of danger. It's best to give them a wide berth--when badly damaged, they are liable to blow up.

alarmour.name: Alarmour
alarmour.description: Undead armour imbued with the ill will of underworld royalty. They were originally decorative sets of armour found jazzing up any number of underworld castle corridors.

a3g15.name: A3G15
a3g15.description: These deadly destroyers were created by a certain dread demon and do their maker proud whenever they march into battle. Comes with a victory-or-your-money-back guarantee.

king_foo_dog.name: King Foo Dog
king_foo_dog.description: Once sacred statues designed to repel evil spirits, they absorbed too much miasma, morphing into man-hating monsters. These chaotic canines would rather bite the hand that feeds them than have a human for a master.

overkilling_machine.name: Overkilling Machine
overkilling_machine.description: These overhauled killing machines boast even more weaponry to make their job of slaughtering foes in combat even simpler.

the_trauminator.name: The Trauminator
the_trauminator.description: A weapon of murderous mayhem fuelled by the blood of its victims that has been in operation sicne time immemorial. Who knows when its reign of terror will finally end?

uberkilling_machine.name: berkilling Machine
uberkilling_machine.description: Killing machines made for a single purpose: manslaughter with extreme prejudice. Fitted with an exquisite suite of weapons to wield, it has a tool for any occasion, provided the occasion is murder.

leery_lout.name: Leery Lout
leery_lout.description: These shy scoundrels dish out damage from behind their smirking shields, which are precious family heirlooms, passed down from father to son.

dracky.name: Dracky
dracky.description: These flapping pains in the neck only come out at night. They love nothing more than slurping up human blood, the fresher the better.

blinkster.name: Blinkster
blinkster.description: Wunderkind wizards of the monster world. On stage, their sleight of hand skills might still be somewhat lacking, but what crowd could boo those adorable baby faces?

lunatick.name: Lunatick
lunatick.description: These curious monsters' enormous eyeballs afford them excellent vision, even in absolute darkness. Once they set their sights on their prey, they will not give up until they wrap their tentacles around it.

teeny_sanguini.name: Teeny Sanguini
teeny_sanguini.description: Baby monsters known for their distinctive bovine markings. Considered to be fully-grown once the black fur grows out, replaced entirely with a ravishing shade of rose pink.

lips.name: Lips
lips.description: Who could resist that king-sized kisser? Protective of their prime assets, you won't catch one of these full-lipped fiends without their trusty lip balm.

succubat.name: Succubat
succubat.description: These bat-like creatures' eyes gleam bewitchingly after sundown, tempting travellers into their killer clutches.

see_urchin.name: See Urchin
see_urchin.description: This cowardly sea creature will flee the very second it senses danger with no concern for the fate of its companions. Few monsters see eye to eye with them on this issue.

imp.name: Imp
imp.description: These youngsters carry the future of the underworld upon their shoulders. Desperate to be seen as grown-up, they're always trying to cast spells they're not yet big or bad enough to perform.

cannonbrawler.name: Cannonbrawler
cannonbrawler.description: Now their ships are sunk, these salty seafarers are trying to regain their land legs. The urge to roam remains strong for some though, who now dream of traversing the world on the back of their trusty cannons.

cyclops.name: Cyclops
cyclops.description: One-eyed wonders proud of their immense power. Despite initial impressions, they are actually kind-hearted nature lovers who love to garden and look after small animals.

jinkster.name: Jinkster
jinkster.description: These cyclopean clowns might look cute and cuddly, but behind closed doors, these underlings of the underworld's overlord are quite the curmudgeons.

beleth.name: Beleth
beleth.description: These dastardly demons will make anyone's blood run cold. The threats of a visit from one is often used by parents to stop their children misbehaving.

hypothermion.name: Hypothermion
hypothermion.description: Part of the underworld's upper crust, these chilling creatures operate as shady string-pullers, particularly skilled at lurking in the sahdows in service to their master.

kisser.name: Kisser
kisser.description: These lips monsters have levelled up by upgrading their lipstick. Their poison kisses steal away their victims' vitality, not to mention their hearts.

sculptrice.name: Sculptrice
sculptrice.description: Once made to ward away evil spirits, these spine-chilling sculptures were somehow invested with a malignant soul and now seek to slaughter humans.

the_time_being.name: The Time Being
the_time_being.description: This sinister sorcerer tried to rule the world by controlling time itself. He's a real stickler for punctuality.

gander.name: Gander
gander.description: Monsters who appear to those who are soon to depart this mortal coil. It's believed they can tell the remaining lifespan of living creatures by simply looking at them, giving a new meaning to the term 'death stare'.

togre.name: Togre
togre.description: This once human hero dared to steal a forbidden spell, incurring the wrath of the gods. Now he's cursed to live as a tragically transfigured whip-wielder wrapped in loose-fitting garments.

jugular_joker.name: Jugular Joker
jugular_joker.description: This gore-soaked jester doesn't rely on gags to make you bust a gut. Catch him performing in the street and it'll cost you more than the change in your pocket.

bilhaw.name: Bilhaw
bilhaw.description: Some say they're woebergines that got teleported between dimensions, and subsequently awakened to their true powers while trapped there. Whatever their story, these dimension-hopping demons are dreadful indeed.

putrefido.name: Putrefido
putrefido.description: These cadaverous canines originally died of exhaustion before being brought back to life by the powers of darkness, though any smarts they had are long gone.

funghoul.name: Funghoul
funghoul.description: These great big gurning mushrooms spring up in their dozens in damp locales. They propagate by putting travellers to sleep and seeding them with their spores.

skeleton.name: Skeleton
skeleton.description: Recycled from the bodies of fallen warriors, these unfortunate cadavers truly get worked to the bone.

stump_chump.name: Stump Chump
stump_chump.description: The tragic remains of chopped-down trees whose deep-seated malice has made them morph into monsters. They attack travellers who try to sit on them, sucking out all their nutrients before discarding the husk.

ghost.name: Ghost
ghost.description: Unfinished business in their previous lives prevents these poltergeists from ever being at peace. They're always trying to inflict a fright one way or another, just for the attention.

skipper.name: Skipper
skipper.description: The unholy union of an abandoned boot and a spherical furball fiend. Best keep your distance--that's a sure recipe for a ripe aroma.

soft_serve_spook.name: Soft Serve Spook
soft_serve_spook.description: This fluffy fellow is often pounced upon by monsters looking for a sweet treat, but the joke's on them as one lick is all it takes to discover they're saltier than smoked sardines.

firespirit.name: Firespirit
firespirit.description: No-one knows for certain how these monsters came to be. Some believe they were born of the fiery 'Frizz' spell, while others think they are the souls of those who died with a burning desire for revenge.

scarfish.name: Scarfish
scarfish.description: Scowling starfish whose bright colouring brightens up beaches in summer. Though they spend most of their lives in the sea, they are capable of walking on two legs.

restless_armour.name: Restless Armour
restless_armour.description: Suits of armour brought to life by the souls of soldiers slaughtered by monsters. Cruelly cursed to fight on forever, blissfully unaware that they're already dead.

shadow.name: Shadow
shadow.description: These monsters are said to have been born in the depths of an unfathomably deep darkness. Adept at imitation, they can even forget their natural appearance if they spend long enough shadowing someone else.

skullrider.name: Skullrider
skullrider.description: These scary swordsmen scurry across the land atop their skeletal steeds. Often found racing chariot chappies, their eternal rivals.

monolog.name: Monolog
monolog.description: Not only is this tree trunk terror able to fly, it can even disguise itself as an ordinary tree stump. Their emergence has left stump chumps everywhere feeling rather supplanted.

mummy_boy.name: Mummy Boy
mummy_boy.description: An ancient king who believed he would be revived after his death and so had his body preserved for the occasion. Unfortunately, dark magic somehow seeped into his cadaver, turning him into this bandage-swaddled terror.

hellbound_horror.name: Hellbound Horror
hellbound_horror.description: These hooded half-pint monsters seem to like making life difficult for themselves, and have tightly bound themselves to their ornate pillars.

dead_resident.name: Dead Resident
dead_resident.description: Even after being worked to death, these poor wretches can't seem to catch a break. When forced to fight, they use the iron ball shackled to their akle to attack, while also unleashing a cavalcade of curses.

skeleton_soldier.name: Skeleton Soldier
skeleton_soldier.description: Knights who were cut down before their time and who have nonw risen again as ghosts. When their energy flags in battle, they recall their distant homeland and take up arms again.

phantom_fencer.name: Phantom Fencer
phantom_fencer.description: The lingering spirits of swordsmen who can't put the past behind them. They search out old foes, never even stopping to sleep.

morphean_mushroom.name: Morphean Mushroom
morphean_mushroom.description: These foul-tempered fungi are believed to have once been human. It seems they increase their number by forcing their victims to feed on their flesh, thereby transforming them into thoroughly miserable mushrooms.

skeleton_swordsman.name: Skeleton Swordsman
skeleton_swordsman.description: Undead master fencers. They originally possessed the standard number of limbs, but they have plucked extra appendages from fallen foes to supplement their strength and now boast a solidly imposing six arms.

cursed_crooner.name: Cursed Crooner
cursed_crooner.description: These singers attack travellers by belting out their malevolent melodies in a baleful baritone. They've picked up quite a following among a certain section of the monster populace.

discombombulator.name: Discombombulator
discombombulator.description: Bomb-like beings who float in the air. Quick to blow a fuse if someone fails to say their name correctly, they swell massively in size, though skilful sweet-talk will see them shrink again.

fightgeist.name: Fightgeist
fightgeist.description: Spirits of the dead which once slept in the bowels of the earth, risen to the surface in search of new companions. They'll try to drag anyone they encounter down to the land of the dead.

skelerton.name: Skelerton
skelerton.description: These sinister sword-swingers are proud of their superior bladesmanship. When they deftly wield their weapons, it entrances victims and tempts them to sleep forevermore.

fright_knight.name: Fright Knight
fright_knight.description: These proud knights draw upon the power of darkness as they wield their ghoulish great swords. They are utterly merciless, prepared to cut down any crony in their command who defies a direct order.
